mobs.long_desc: A Ghoul stands here, nibbling on a bit of flesh.
mobs.desc: You see a small figure dressed in tattered clothes. His pasty skin contrasts sharply with his blood-red eyes. As he sees you he grins, revealing a row of very sharp teeth.

mobs.long_desc: An Enchanted Skeleton is here, patrolling the area.
mobs.desc: This is no natural creation! The skeleton stands ten feet tall, and its bones are incredibly thick. The skeleton lacks intelligence of any kind, but there seems to be some purpose infused into its being... The skeleton moves in a very jerky, irregular manner.

mobs.long_desc: The Sentinel is here, guarding a doorway.
mobs.desc: The sentinel has guarded this room for over two thousand years without being defeated. As you look at it, you begin to understand why. The sentinel towers far above you, and is composed of pure iron. Its eyes glow blue. Though it does not carry a weapon, it looks formidable enough to annihilate any adventurer foolish enough to cross its path.

mobs.long_desc: A dark shape darts past your feet.
mobs.desc: This creature has a glossy black coat and very sharp teeth. It is three feet long! The rat looks like it has not had a full meal in a very long time... perhaps that will change soon!

mobs.keywords: animated-statue statue animated guard warrior stone stony
mobs.long_desc: An Animated statue stands here, looking fierce.
mobs.desc: This statue is made to resemble a warrior. The details of the statue are perfect; were you to turn its stony skin to a fleshy tone, it would resemble a man in every way.

mobs.long_desc: The Eidolon floats here, admiring some artwork.
mobs.desc: This apparition wavers into and out of existence. Its thread to this world appears to be very tentative. The Eidolon seems disturbed by your presence.

mobs.long_desc: The High Priestess stands here, chanting dark prayers.
mobs.desc: The High Priestess stands tall and confident as you approach. She is blind, but her sense of smell and hearing are so acute she is very much aware of your presence. The Priestess is dressed in a long gray robe made of a course material; the robe is heavily stained with the blood of many sacrifices.

mobs.long_desc: A Blind Priest shuffles by you, meditating.
mobs.desc: As you examine this priest he turns toward you, and as his milky white eyes bore into yours you realize that he is blind. Perhaps his ancestors have lived in the dark for so long they have lost the ability to see.

mobs.long_desc: The Wailing Shade floats here, screaming in a thousand voices.
mobs.desc: This creature shifts shape rapidly; one moment it appears to be a tall nobleman, the next, a young boy, or perhaps a motherly middle-aged woman. Whatever form the shade assumes from moment to moment, they all have one thing in common: their eyes burn with pain, and they scream in agony.

mobs.long_desc: The Young Witch is here, reading a book.
mobs.desc: She is young and would be very pretty, were it not for the vile expression upon her face. Her silk hair cascades over a dress woven of very fine material.

mobs.long_desc: The Undead KingPriest stands here, praying to his god.
mobs.desc: Standing before you is the mighty KingPriest. The most powerful cleric of his time, he was denied immortality by the gods. His intense hate of life allows him to bridge the gap between this world and the next. The KingPriest is the very incarnation of evil; with every breath he expels the stench of hell.

mobs.long_desc: The Undead Prince is here, contemplating past loses.
mobs.desc: You wonder how this noble creature came to reside in this underworld. The prince has been perfectly preserved from the moment of his death; his skin even maintains a healthy flush. However, his eyes seem fixed on something distant, and there is an expression of infinite sadness upon his face. He does not seem to be aware of your presence.

mobs.long_desc: A Skeletal Guardian stands here, fulfilling a vow.
mobs.desc: The guardian pledged his undying love and allegiance to his prince over 2000 years ago, and has maintained that pledge since. No force compels him to remain in this world; he continues to attend to his duties out of a sense of honor.

mobs.long_desc: The Craven clicks its talons nervously as you approach.
mobs.desc: The craven is a hunch-backed, furry creature. One of the misbegotten spawn of the wizard's lab, it now serves the wizard in the capacity of familiar. Though it is powerfully built and looks like a formidable opponent, it seems to be afraid of you.

mobs.long_desc: Jerajai's claws click loudly on the passageway floor as he charges towards you...
mobs.desc: Your blood chills as you look at this creature, for this is Jerajai, spawn of the great black dragon Sagece. Only a hundred years old, Jerajai is still a juvenile, but his rage over being a captive has made him fierce beyond his age. His talons click loudly on the passageway floor as he charges towards you.

mobs.long_desc: Thelriki's claws click loudly on the passageway floor as she charges towards you...
mobs.desc: Your blood chills as you look at this creature, for this is Thelriki, spawn of the great black dragon Sagece. Only a hundred years old, Thelriki is still a juvenile, but her rage over being a captive has made her fierce beyond her age. Her talons click loudly on the passageway floor as she charges towards you.

mobs.long_desc: A Witch is here, kneeling in front of an alcove.
mobs.desc: The witch is not very old, perhaps thirty, but her eyes are deep with knowledge of dark things. Her face is totally void of emotion. She has one purpose in life, and that purpose is to serve her master, the Lich. She is garbed in a dress fine enough for a wedding.

mobs.long_desc: The Lich stands here, laughing at your foolishness.
mobs.desc: Over 2000 years ago this man became the first mortal to ever achieve immortality through wizardry.  It is apparent as you gaze at him that the Lich's spells were not entirely successful; he does age, just at a fantastically retarded rate.  His face is shrivelled with age lines, and his clumpy white hair hangs down past his shoulders.  Despite his apparent advanced age, he stands tall and confident as you approach.

mobs.long_desc: The Elder Witch is here, protecting her coven.
mobs.desc: This woman has evaded death for many years. The witch's face is heavily lined with age, and her hands are blotchy and tremble visibly. Perhaps it was magic that has kept her alive for so long, or perhaps the intense desire to serve her master; whatever the cause, she is only mortal and will die soon. However, no remorse for the evil she has committed is apparent in her mien; when she dies she knows she will be sentenced to the deepest pit in hell.

mobs.long_desc: A Vampire Bat is here, hanging from the ceiling.
mobs.desc: The size of a small dog, this bat has a slightly famished look. It seems it has been a long time since it has had the chance to feast on human blood.

mobs.long_desc: Zalkar the Demon Lord stands here, looking for dinner.
mobs.desc: The demon was summoned here by a wizard. You wonder what foul purpose the wizard intended by summoning this demon. The demon stands ten feet tall, and has magma red skin.

mobs.keywords: rhalean evil sister beast guard rhae rhaleans-evil-sister
mobs.long_desc: A Rhalean appears with an ear-popping bang!
mobs.desc: This furry creature seems to have appeared out of thin air.  It is very small, barely four feet tall, but it has powerful jaws and very sharp teeth.

mobs.long_desc: A dark shape darts past your feet.
mobs.desc: This creature has a glossy black coat and very sharp teeth. It is three feet long! The rat looks like it has not had a full meal in a very long time... perhaps that will change soon!

mobs.long_desc: A dark shape darts past your feet.
mobs.desc: This creature has a glossy black coat and very sharp teeth. It is three feet long! The rat looks like it has not had a full meal in a very long time... perhaps that will change soon!

mobs.long_desc: A dark shape darts past your feet.
mobs.desc: This creature has a glossy black coat and very sharp teeth. It is three feet long! The rat looks like it has not had a full meal in a very long time... perhaps that will change soon!

mobs.long_desc: A huge infidel warrior rests here meditating.
mobs.desc: This warrior looks large and strong. His flesh is starting to decay although powerful necromantic spells have obviously been used to prevent him from rotting altogether.

mobs.long_desc: A tall warrior stands here waiting for you.
mobs.desc: He is large and powerful. You can see the resemblances to the undead infidel except somehow he is alive now. He smirks cruelly as he sees you and you sense that he is highly trained and possibly more than a match for you.

mobs.long_desc: The Wraith of the KingPriest floats over you, poised to strike!
mobs.desc: Floating before you is the wraith of the mighty KingPriest.  The most powerful cleric of his time, he was denied immortality by the gods.  His intense hate of life allows him to bridge the gap between this world and the next.  The KingPriest is the very incarnation of evil with every breath he expels the stench of hell.

mobs.long_desc: A large stone golem stands here.
mobs.desc: Your gaze seems to miss this being.

mobs.long_desc: A short, squat dwarven ranger guards the entrance to the barrow.
mobs.desc: This dwarf is a member of the ranger guard that keeps watch over extremely dangerous places.  She wears a long slate gray cloak, a loose tunic, thick pants, and sturdy boots.  In her hands she brandishes two dwarven axes, representing both her training and her heritage.  She is tasked with preventing the unwitting from stumbling into this barrow by accident.

objects.ground: A stone sword lies here.

extras.text: Made of solid stone, the sword has been magically enhanced to have a blade sharper and stronger than steel.  The sword is so large and heavy that only the mightiest of warriors may wield it.

objects.ground: A wicked-looking dagger has been dropped here.

extras.text: This dagger was constructed for one purpose and one purpose only, and that was to shed lives for the glory of the dark god.  The dagger's blade gleams wetly and is slippery to the touch, even when completely dry.

objects.ground: A large hammer has been dropped here.

extras.text: This is a very ancient weapon, crafted and enchanted long before your time. The head of the hammer is pure mythril, and connects to a haft composed of a strange black metal.

objects.ground: An ancient blade has been left here.

extras.text: One glance at this weapon is enough to tell you that it has been powerfully enchanted.  Black runes run the length of the sword, and a dull white flame surrounds the blade.  The blade itself has an odd purple hue.

objects.ground: A long rod, fashioned from black metal, lies here.

extras.text: The rod is composed of a strange black metal that is surprisingly light.  It is decorated with an assortment of silvery figures, among them a wolf, and eagle, and a falcon.

objects.ground: A beautiful dress has been left here.

extras.text: Made of a very fine, smooth material, it is elegant enough to satisfy any noblewoman.  You imagine it would look very sexy on you.

objects.ground: A glass jar with icky contents lies here.

extras.text: Inside this glass jar is a thick, loamy substance. You see dark particles floating within, and try not to imagine what the ingredients are.

objects.ground: A long metal rod has been dropped here.

extras.text: The power of this device is evident to any who look at it.  It is as tall as a staff, although somewhat slimmer.  It is composed of a black metal which is quite a bit lighter than iron.

objects.ground: A rod has been carelessly dropped here.

extras.text: This majestic rod lacks decorations of any kind. It elegance lies in its simplicity and the strange, unworldy hue of the black metal from which it was fashioned.

objects.ground: A statuette is here, waiting to be admired.

extras.text: Carved from stone and shaped into the likeness of an imp, this statuette at first glance appears to be worthless. However, a closer inspection reveals minute mystical symbols running alone the back of the imp.

objects.ground: A shining golden breastplate has been left here.

extras.text: Although the breastplate is over 2000 years old, it lacks any sign of age or use; it has neither dents nor rust.  It appears to be fantastic armor.

objects.ground: The sentinel's key has been left here.

extras.text: Well, it's a key!

objects.ground: A brown key has been dropped here.

extras.text: Well, it's a key!

objects.ground: The convert's key has been dropped here.

extras.text: Well, it's a key!

objects.ground: A gray key lies here.

extras.text: Well, it's a key!

objects.ground: An indigo key lies here.

extras.text: Well, it's a key!

objects.ground: The summoner's key lies here.

extras.text: Well, it's a key!

objects.ground: The Lich's key has been left here.

extras.text: As you look at this key you feel a shiver run down your spine. There seems to be something... unholy about it.

objects.ground: A ring engraved with the symbol of eternity lies here.

extras.text: This ring has numerous symbols carved onto its silvery surface.  The most prominent symbol is that of a snake eating its own tail.

objects.ground: An intricately carved ivory staff lies here.

extras.text: It is covered in intricate carvings which seem to indicate its use.
The carvings seem to show a group of people vanishing from one room and appearing in another.

objects.ground: A stone tomb lies in the center of the room.

extras.text: The symbol of a rose is carved onto the stone tomb.

objects.ground: A large iron-bound chest is here.

extras.text: The chest looks like it contains great treasures.

objects.ground: A pile of platinum coins lies here.

extras.text: A huge pile of gold lies before you.

objects.ground: A long polished scimitar lies in the dirt here.
A large black jewel glows ominously at you.

extras.text: Inside the Heartstone you see a small fleck of green which seems to pulse at odd intervals.  The Heartstone itself is a large black jewel.  You have never seen anything quite like it before.

objects.short: the skull of the Undead Prince
objects.ground: An ancient skull lies cracked in the dirt.
A heart-shaped key lies here.

extras.text: The key is shaped into a heart.

objects.ground: A simple coffin lies here.

extras.text: The coffin is simple, yet has an elegant beauty.

objects.ground: No mortal should see this! :-)

extras.text: The writing reads, "Gaze upon those that have opposed me and know that I am supreme."

objects.ground: The jeweled eyes of a ceramic green spider wink at you.

extras.text: This ceramic is a work of art.  The green spider appears life-like, forever frozen in one position.  The spider's ruby eyes sparkle in the light, the only sign that it is an artificial creation.

objects.ground: The noble's key lies here.

extras.text: Well, it's a key!

objects.ground: The head of the infidel has rolled over here.

extras.text: The hair on this head is matted down, and the eyelashes occasionally blink over the opening where the eyeball should be.

objects.ground: A skeleton lies here in a crumpled heap.

extras.text: You're not sure but the hand seems to be clutching something...

objects.ground: A headless corpse lies here.

extras.text: That's it, you've lost it!! You puke all over your clothes!

objects.ground: A wooden chest is here, containing great treasures.

extras.text: The chest is old and the wood is badly cracked.

objects.ground: A small carved stone lies on the ground.

extras.text: The carving seems to depict a person disappearing from a tomb and reappearing in a town.

objects.ground: Glowing red eyes rest here.

extras.text: They're a pair of magical red eyes that strike fear into the hearts of those who oppose their owner.

objects.ground: An eyeball lies here on the ground getting dusty.

extras.text: The eye of the infidel is bloodshot and pale.

objects.ground: An ancient bronze lance stands impaled in the earth.

extras.text: Forged from bronze and dedicated to the beings in the heavens above in a time long forgotten, this ancient lance is a deadly weapon the likes of which are not found in the modern world.  The long wooden haft is banded with thick bronze rings decorated with elaborate sigils of the sky and sun.  The head of the land is a double-bladed point made of bronze polished to a glittering shine.

objects.ground: A jagged staff of decaying flesh and broken glass rots away.

triggers.name: infidel_dead
triggers.commands: mload obj 48031 mload obj 48037

triggers.name: timer_on_recall
triggers.commands: oechoaround %actor% As %actor.name% grabs the stone you feel a lurch in your stomach. osend %actor% You feel the stone burn against your hand for a second and it is gone! oteleport all 48080 oforce all look return 0

triggers.name: lich_ring_compo_change
triggers.commands: osend %actor% As you slide %self.shortdesc% on your finger, your flesh starts to die and slump off. osend %actor% You transform into a skeleton!

triggers.name: young_witch_greet1
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.level% < 60 msend %actor.name% The young witch says, 'I may still be learning, but I know enough to destroy you.' else msend %actor.name% The young witch says, 'At last a chance to test myself on a worthy opponent.' end end

triggers.name: young_witch_greet2
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 msend %actor.name% The young witch drops her book and hisses at you. endif

triggers.name: kingspriest_fight1_long
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 shout You will never truely defeat me! mecho &3The Undead KingPriest throws up his head and&0 &3&bhis eyes&0 &1&bglow&0 &7&bwhite&0 &3with rage!&0 mgoto 48084 mjunk hammer mload mob 48027 mforce wraith mload obj 48002 mforce wraith mload obj 48036 mforce wraith wear all mload mob 48028 mload mob 48028 mload mob 48028 mteleport wraith 48045 mteleport shadow-guardian 48045 mteleport shadow-guardian 48045 mteleport shadow-guardian 48045 mgoto 48045 mecho &3The Undead KingPriest Cracks in&0 &1&btwo,&0 &7&bsplit open by a white light.&0 mecho &3From the shell emerges the&0 &6&bWraith of the KingPriest!&0 mforce wraith shout Come to me my guardians!  We have souls to claim! mecho &2&bThe stone of the floor and wall erupt into statues of shadowy guardians!&0 mforce wraith kill %actor.name% mforce shadow kill %actor.name% mforce 2.shadow kill %actor.name% mforce 3.shadow kill %actor.name% mgoto 48084 else endif

triggers.name: kingpriest_allgreet1
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% > 350 say I think my god must have thought I had forgotten him. grin %actor.name% say If you can be my message. endif

triggers.name: prince_receive1
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %object.vnum% == 48031 if %actor.align% > 350 say Ah, even though I did not strike the killing blow, I can feel the years of desire for revenge have been completed. say Thank you %actor.name%, I hope this gift will help you against the king. else say Hmm, although your motives are not pure, you have done me a great service. wait 1 say In return I will give you this staff, may you find it a help as you continue in your quest. endif mload obj 48019 give staff %actor.name% mjunk head_of_the_infidel endif endif

triggers.name: prince_speak1
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% > 350 && %actor.level% > 80 wait 2 say If you bring me the head of the king's dark champion, then I will give you an item that may help you in your battle with the king. wait 1 say According to our rules of dueling, you must say 'the prince wishes to challenge you by proxy', before starting the fight. wait 1 smile say That way, I can claim the victory as my own. endif

triggers.name: prince_speak2
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% > 350 if %actor.level% > 80 wait 2 say Yes.  He is still alive due to his magic arts, and so he can still be killed. wait 1 say He is a coward, however, and I have heard that when the tides of battle turn against him, he is quick to disappear. say I may have something to help you with that if you are willing to... trade. else wait 2 say Sadly yes, you have come too soon.  If you are able to return once you are stronger, perhaps you can be of great assistance then. endif endif

triggers.name: prince_speak3
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% > 350 wait 2 say Yes.  I was too confident and his dark infidel champion overcame me. grumble wait 1 say As a punishment, the King brought me back to life, and now I am compelled to do his bidding. frown if %actor.level% >80 say But you might be powerful enough to destroy him. else say It is a shame you will not be powerful enough to destroy him. endif endif

triggers.name: prince_speak4
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% > 349 wait 2 sigh say Many years ago when King Ureal threatened the land, I swore that I would try to stop him. wait 1 say I was the paladin champion, and it was my duty to bring an end to his evil. wait 1 emote sighs again loudly. say But I failed. endif

triggers.name: prince_greet1
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% > 349 say Are you here to help me? elseif %actor.align% < -349 say Are you here to challenge me? endif

triggers.name: witch_rand1
triggers.commands: ponder elder

triggers.name: lich_speak1
triggers.commands: ponder say You know my name, but do you know my power? cast 'disintegrate' %actor.name%

triggers.name: lich_greet1
triggers.commands: cackle say So, %actor.name% do you know who you face?

triggers.name: lich_rand1
triggers.commands: emote watches you closely, his hunger for your lifeforce palpable.

triggers.name: elder_rand1
triggers.commands: glare barrow-witch say Stop trying to peep at the recipe youngster.  If I die, then you can see it. cackle wait 1 say If... glare

triggers.name: elder_rand2
triggers.commands: whap barrow-witch say Don't mix the eye-of-newt with the toad blood yet idiot! say Do you want to kill us all??

triggers.name: infidel_speak1
triggers.argument_list: the prince wishes to challenge you by proxy
triggers.commands: rofl say I beat him once already. if %actor.level% > 70 say Hmm, you look like you might give me a reasonable battle. say Well...let me even the odds a a little. else say HAH!  His honor depends on you?! say However, this should put the result beyond doubt. endif rem scimitar wait 3 emote waves his hands in the air in a mystical gesture. emote murmurs a spell and suddenly looks younger! mat 48084 mload mob 48026 wait 1 say Prepare to meet whichever god you believe in! mat 48084 give polished-scimitar infidel-warrior-youthful mat 48084 mforce infidel-warrior-youthful wield scimitar mteleport infidel-warrior-youthful 48038 mforce infidel-warrior-youthful kill %actor.name% mgoto 48084 mjunk all mpurge %self%

triggers.name: infidel_speak2
triggers.commands: say Yes, challenge.  I presume you have been sent by that young upstart. spit wait 1 say If you haven't, then you had better leave before my patience wears thin. ponder wait 1 say And if you have, then you'd better leave before I kill you. pat %actor.name% say Run along now little one.

triggers.name: infidel_allgreet1
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% > -350 say So %actor.name%, do you dare to challenge me? else say So %actor.name%, will you help me seek my revenge? endif

triggers.name: infidel2_fight
triggers.commands: set fight %time.stamp% global fight if %random.10% < 4 mecho The body of the infidel shifts slightly but remains renewed. endif

triggers.name: Jerajai_Attack
triggers.commands: set val %random.10% switch %val% case 1 breath acid break case 2 case 3 sweep break case 4 case 5 roar break default growl done

triggers.name: Thelriki_Attack
triggers.commands: set val %random.10% switch %val% case 1 breath gas break case 2 case 3 sweep break case 4 case 5 roar break default growl done

triggers.name: infidel2_random
triggers.commands: set now %time.stamp% if %now% - 1 > %fight% emote looks around for someone to fight. sniff remove scimitar emote waves his hands in the air in a mystical manner. wait 1 mecho The body of the infidel ages rapidly to return to the decayed state. mat 48084 mload mob 48025 mat 48084 give polished-scimitar infidel-warrior-necrotic mat 48084 mforce infidel-warrior-necrotic wield scimitar mat 48084 mteleport infidel-warrior-necrotic 48038 mforce infidel-warrior-necrotic groan mforce infidel-warrior-necrotic say I hate this form. mgoto 48084 mjunk all mpurge %self% endif

triggers.name: Infidel speech revenge
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% < -349 wait 2 grin say Many centuries ago, I was the champion of King Ureal, the mighty sorcerer who would conquer Ethilien. wait 1 say Some pathetic paladin sought to slay our King, claiming it was his duty to bring an end to his reign. wait 1 say He challenged me to a duel. chuckle wait 1 say And lost. endif

triggers.name: Infidel speech lost
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% < -349 wait 2 laugh say Yes.  He was overconfident and reckless.  I easily snuffed him out. flex wait 1 say As a punishment, the King brought him back to life, and toys with him deep in this barrow. wait 1 frown say But he continues to be a thorn in my King's side...  The prince continues to try to destroy my King, even as he become Eternal in Death. wait 1 if %actor.level% >80 say But you might be powerful enough to destroy the prince for good. else say It is a shame you will not be powerful enough to destroy the prince forever. endif endif

triggers.name: Infidel speech destroy?
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% < -349 if %actor.level% > 80 wait 2 say If you bring me the prince's skull, I can reward you. wait 1 say He is bound by certain rules.  If you say 'the champion wishes to challenge you by proxy', he will be forced to fight you. wait 1 smile say That way, my victory will be absolute. else say If you are able to return once you are stronger, perhaps you can be of great assistance then. wait 1 say Now leave. endif endif

triggers.name: Prince speech challenge
triggers.argument_list: the champion wishes to challenge you by proxy
triggers.commands: mecho %self.name% shutters at the challenge. set drop_head 1 global drop_head if %actor.level% > 70 say You look like a true threat.  But do not wonder, I have grown greatly since my death. else say A shame he sends one still so inexperienced.  However, this should put the result beyond doubt. endif if %get.mob_count[48012]% < 2 eval needed 2 - %get.mob_count[48012]% mecho %self.name% calls out the spirits of his Royal Guard! set loop 0 while %loop% < %needed% mecho %self.name% summons %get.mob_shortdesc[48012]%! mload mob 48012 eval loop %loop% + 1 done endif if !%self.wearing[48003]% mecho %self.name% lifts %get.obj_shortdesc[48003]% from the chamber floor. mload obj 48003 wie indigo-blade endif if !%self.wearing[48010]% mecho %self.name% lifts %get.obj_shortdesc[48010]% from the chamber floor. mload obj 48010 wear breastplate endif say En garde! wait 1s kill %actor%

triggers.name: Prince death
triggers.commands: if %drop_head% mload obj 48025 endif

triggers.name: Infidel receive
triggers.commands: wait 2 mjunk %object% mecho %self.name% grins as he crushes the Prince's skull to dust. wait 1s laugh say Good, just as it should be. wait 2s mecho %self.name% dusts off his hands and produces a sickly gnarled staff from his belongings. wait 1s say Take this as a reward. mload obj 48039 give infidels-staff %actor% set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% while %i% > 0 set person %actor.group_member[%i%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[hell_trident]% == 2 if !%person.quest_variable[hell_trident:helltask6]% quest variable hell_trident %person% helltask6 1 endif endif msend %person% &3&bYou have finished the infidel's duel!&0 endif eval i %i% - 1 done else if %person.quest_stage[hell_trident]% == 2 if !%person.quest_variable[hell_trident:helltask6]% quest variable hell_trident %person% helltask6 1 endif endif msend %person% &3&bYou have finished the infidel's duel!&0 endif

triggers.name: Barrow guard
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.level% < 60 whisper %actor.name% This barrow is far too dangerous without more experience. whisper %actor.name% Very few who venture further have ever returned. wait 1 whisper %actor.name% Come back when you're ready for imminent danger. else return 0 endif else return 0 endif

rooms.name: The Barrow
rooms.description: Before you rises a large mound of stone.  You recognize the mound as the burial site of some powerful individual, perhaps a king, long since dead.  You pause momentarily to pay respect to this king and are about to move on, when something odd about the mound catches your eye.  It seems that there is a gap between two of the larger stones, and that you can see darkness between the gap, and not more stones, as one would expect.  Upon further investigation, you find that the two stones may be readily removed, which you proceed to do, and to your surprise, you discover that a small tunnel slanting down through the mound and into the earth has been revealed.

Down.description: You see a small tunnel descending into the earth.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel is very small, and you are forced to get down on your hands and knees to crawl through it.  Small stones and dirt rain down upon your head as you make your way along the tunnel, but you are fairly certain the structure will not collapse upon you.

rooms.name: Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel continues to slant down, growing wider as it does so, until you are able to walk in a crouch, and finally, erect.

rooms.name: End of the Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel continues down for some distance, then levels out and continues in a northern direction, finally stopping at a door.  A small branch passageway continues to the east.  There are doors to the west and north.

North.description: You see a heavily splintered oak door.

rooms.name: The Crypt
rooms.description: You have entered a room which once housed the deceased nobles of a great kingdom.  Numerous stone tombs lie in orderly rows along the length of the room.  These tombs were looted long ago, and their occupants thrown disgracefully to the floor.  The bony remains of there former lords now litter the floor in piles.  You observe with some surprise that many of the bones have jagged tooth marks imprinted upon them.  There is an archway to the west and a door to the south.

South.description: You see a heavily splintered oak door.

rooms.name: The Crypt
rooms.description: This room is in the same state as the crypt to the east: tombs lie empty, and bones decorate the floor in piles.  There is an archway to the east.

North.description: You see the faint outline of a panel.

rooms.name: Chamber of Riches
rooms.description: In this room were kept some of the prize possessions of the nobles, possession they were hoping to treasure in the afterlife.  This room was hidden to prevent looting; however, the attempt was futile, for the room is barren.

South.description: You see the faint outline of a panel.

rooms.name: Chamber of Eternity
rooms.description: This room has numerous murals decorating the walls.  The murals depict the life of King Braeran. If the murals are to be believed, he was a fair and just king, beloved by his people. There is a door to the east.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: This short passageway runs from east to west through what feels like solid rock. The dust on the floor is covered with footprints, most of them unidentifiable. A door stands at the east end of the passage.

rooms.name: The Sentinel's Room
rooms.description: This is a small, barren room.  A skeleton lies sprawled across the floor, its fingers still clutched around the hilt of a long sword.  You see doors to the east and west.

East.description: You see a stone door, engraved with the symbol of a rose.

rooms.name: King Braeran's Chamber
rooms.description: This room was once beautifully decorated with murals, ceramic, and vases. Now, the murals are vandalized, the ceramics smashed and the vases shattered. As you walk across the floor, the once beautiful treasures crunch underfoot. There is a door to the north.

South.description: You see the faint outline of a panel.

West.description: You see a stone door, engraved with the symbol of a rose.

rooms.name: King Braeran's Burial Chamber
rooms.description: This plain, spartan room is made entirely of stone. It is small and smells incredibly dusty; there is little to recommend the chamber.

North.description: You see the faint outline of a panel.

rooms.name: Hidden Staircase
rooms.description: A cramped staircase spirals down into the darkness.  The stones of the staircase are heavily worn, indicating that many people have used this staircase ahead of you.  There is a door to the south.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: You are at the bottom of a spiral staircase.  There are arches to the south and west.  You hear strange rustling noises from the south.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The rustling sound gets louder the further south you go.  At the south end of the passageway there is an oak door.  There is an arch to the north.

South.description: You see a door. A treasure chest has been engraved upon the wooden surface.

rooms.name: Rustling Room
rooms.description: As you step into this room, you see numerous shadows darting across the floor.  Try as hard as you may, you can make out neither the source of the shadows nor the rustling noises.  At the far end of the room, you glimpse the skeletal remains of a former adventurerer or looter.  As you survey the room, you hear a loud *CLICK* as the door behind you locks!  You are trapped!

rooms.name: Hall of Beauty
rooms.description: You have entered the eastern end of a rectangular room that once showcased the prizes of some dead king's realm.  Not surprisingly, the room has been thoroughly looted.  The hall continues to the west, and an archway is to the east.

rooms.name: Hall of Beauty
rooms.description: You have entered the western end of a rectangular room that once showcased the prizes of some dead king's realm.  All items of value have long since been looted.  The only objects remaining in the room are a score of statues of varying sizes.  Some of the statues are amazingly life-like.  The hall continues to the east.

South.description: There is a crack in the wall. A secret door perhaps?

rooms.name: Chamber of Readiness
rooms.description: This room appears to have been used as a bedroom at one point in time. There is an iron bed frame in one corner, and a rotting dresser pushed against the far wall.  A painting along one wall, largely undisturbed by vandals, depicts a sickly, bed-ridden man surrounded by priests.  There are doors to the east and west.

North.description: There is a crack in the wall. A secret door perhaps?

rooms.name: Tomb of Karael
rooms.description: In this room lies the tomb of the great king Karael.  The king was obviously a great lover of art, for there are a number of lavish paintings and beautiful ceramics here.

rooms.name: Chamber of Eternity
rooms.description: In this room you find murals depicting the reign of King Karael.  It seems he was a patron of the arts, for many of the murals picture a variety of artisans engaged in their projects, with the king always standing in the background.

South.description: You see a faint rectangular outline on the surface of the wall.

rooms.name: Inside the Fissure
rooms.description: You enter the fissure and travel a short distance down a tunnel, finally entering a small room.  There seem to be a number of shadows racing along the room's floor...  The only way out is back up the fissure.

Up.description: The fissure is above you and may be easily climbed.

rooms.name: Staircase
rooms.description: The staircase leads downward, through solid rock. The stones of the staircase look quite worn.

North.description: You see a faint rectangular outline of the surface of the wall

rooms.name: Bloody Staircase
rooms.description: You are at the bottom of a staircase which spirals into the darkness above. The bottom few steps of the stone staircase are slippery with fresh blood. There is an archway to the west and a curtain to the north.

rooms.name: Dark Temple
rooms.description: You are standing at the southern end of a temple dedicated to a dark god. Except for your light source, the temple lacks illumination of any kind.  Your first thought is that the temple has been abandoned, until you hear a faint chanting resonating throughout the cavernous temple.  There is a curtain to the south.

rooms.name: Dark Temple
rooms.description: You have reached the center of the Dark Temple.  Chanting resonates throughout the temple, making it difficult to determine its source; however, the chanting seems loudest from the north.

rooms.name: Dark Temple
rooms.description: The temple is shrouded in darkness.  You detect a faint chanting sound, but cannot determine its source.  Your light effectively banishes the darkness from your immediate surroundings, but you do not take comfort from it.  Rather, you feel very exposed and ill at ease.

rooms.name: Dark Temple
rooms.description: This chamber must be a temple, but it is shrouded in darkness. A faint chanting noise reverbrates off the stone of the walls. There are a few candles in sconces on the walls, but they do not illumine much at all.

rooms.name: Dark Temple
rooms.description: The temple is shrouded in darkness.  You detect a faint chanting sound, but cannot determine its source.  Your light effectively banishes the darkness from your immediate surroundings, but you do not take comfort from it.  Rather, you feel very exposed and ill at ease.

rooms.name: Dark Temple
rooms.description: The temple is shrouded in darkness.  You detect a faint chanting sound, but cannot determine its source.  Your light effectively banishes the darkness from your immediate surroundings, but you do not take comfort from it.  Rather, you feel very exposed and ill at ease.  There is a door to the south.

rooms.name: Dark Temple
rooms.description: You are in a corner of the temple.  The temple continues to the south and east.  Chanting resonates throughout the temple, but it seems to be loudest from the east.

rooms.name: Dark Temple
rooms.description: You are in the corner of the temple.  The temple continues to the south and west.  Chanting resonates throughout the temple, but it seems loudest from the west.

rooms.name: Dark Altar
rooms.description: There is an altar here, fashioned from pure ivory.  The altar itself is plain, lacking decorations of any kind.  You see, however, that it has recently been smeared with some dark substance, perhaps blood.  Behind the altar towers the immense statue of a dark god.  The statue's features are indistinct and crude; the statue was shaped by unskilled or clumsy hands.  There is a door to the north.

rooms.name: Meditation Room
rooms.description: This is the worship chamber of the High Priestess.  You see no desk or religious artifacts, only a ragged rug covering the floor.  This room is cold and unwelcoming and perhaps it is best not to linger here.  There is a door to the south.

rooms.name: Chamber of Submission
rooms.description: You shiver uncomfortably as you step into this room.  The ceiling is covered with frescoes depicting chained men and women being forced into this room, and coerced into pledging allegiance to the dark god, before being sacrificed. There are doors to the north and south.

South.description: You see an iron-bound oak door.

rooms.name: Chamber of Horrors
rooms.description: The walls and floor of this room are decorated with red tiles.  The vivid color of the tiles has faded over time, but the chamber still appears to be washed in blood.  There are numerous implements of torture in the room.  You recognize the rack and the iron maiden, but there are many other devices in this room you cannot imagine the function of.

North.description: You see an iron-bound oak door.

rooms.name: Neglected Library
rooms.description: This room is lined with stone bookcases.  The bookshelves display a number of books, but many more volumes are scattered about the floor in heaps, rotting.  You wonder why this room has been so neglected.  There is a door to the south and an archway to the east.

West.description: It appears that the bookcase may be swung out from the wall.

rooms.name: Hall of the Infidel
rooms.description: Running along the length of this wall are a dozen dirty glass panes.  The panes are obscured by a thick layer of dust; you cannot see what is behind them.  Approaching one of the panes, you wipe away an eon's accumulation of dust with the broad swipe of your hand.  Peering into the glass, you see the embalmbed corpse of a man entombed in a niche in the wall.  There is a door to the north, and the hall continues to the south.

rooms.name: Hall of the Infidel
rooms.description: Running along the length of this hall are about a dozen filthy glass panes. You consider examining the panes further, but refrain from doing so, fearful of what you may discover.  You notice some writing along one of the walls.  The hall continues to the north.

extras.text: The writing reads, "Gaze upon those that have opposed me and know that I am supreme."

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: You detect a faint tint of evil permeating the air.  The passageway continues to the west.

East.description: You see the backside of a bookcase.

rooms.name: Passageway Junction
rooms.description: The stench of evil lies heavily in the air.  There are passageways to the south and east, an archway to the west and a door to the north.

rooms.name: Deep Room
rooms.description: As you enter this room, you are shocked to discover it has no floor!  Below your feet is nothing but air.  You wonder how far you would have fallen had you not had the ability to fly.  There is a door to the south.

rooms.name: Trap Room
rooms.description: You find yourself some 40 meters below the room from which you arrived. The walls of the room are obsidian slick, lacking handhold of any kind.  You see no way out of the room.  You are trapped!

rooms.name: Chamber of Eternity
rooms.description: You have entered a room which has a mural spanning one wall.  Aside from the mural, the chamber is empty.  The mural depicts the life of the mighty KingPriest.  The mural displays the KingPriest enforcing the faith of a vile and dark god upon his people.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The stench of evil is almost overpowering; without question, you are near to the source of this stench.  The passageway continues to the north, and there is a door to the south.

East.description: You see the faint outline of a panel.

rooms.name: Heart of Darkness
rooms.description: The floor and walls of this room are badly warped.  The floor is buckled at irregular intervals, and as you watch, another buckle erupts into being.  The walls pulse crazily.  It is as if the very earth is disturbed by the evil secreted within this room.  Your light seems to be oppressed by the darkness of this chamber.  There is a heavy stone chair of the far side of the room, shaped in the likeness of a demon.  The chair is bedecked with jewels.  You imagine it was once the throne of the evil KingPriest.  The only exit is through a door to the north.

rooms.name: Staircase
rooms.description: You are at the top of a staircase that is choked with cobwebs.

West.description: You see the faint outline of a panel.

Up.description: You see a faint line in the ceiling, a trapdoor perhaps?

rooms.name: Staircase
rooms.description: You are at the bottom of a staircase that is choked with cobwebs.  There is an archway to the west.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: This curving passageway is crafted of smooth, glassy black stone, without a single nick or scrape along its perfect surface. It curves from north to east, and is unlit.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: You are standing in a passageway which runs north-south.  The stones of this passageway are of the purest black and as smooth as glass.  Surely this passageway was created through magical means.  You must continue along this passage in either a north or south direction; there are no other exits.

West.description: Lost in the shadows, you see a door.

rooms.name: Chamber of Despair
rooms.description: A shockingly vivid sense of despair makes you stumble as you enter this room.  A sense of loss permeates the air; as you scramble to regain your senses, you realize that some great being has suffered here for an unimaginable span of time.  The chamber itself is richly decorated with tapestries and murals.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The passage continues to run north-south.  The stones of this passage are of the purest black and as smooth as glass.  Surely this passageway was created through magical means.  You must continue along the passage in either the north or south direction; there are no other exits.

rooms.name: Bend in the passageway
rooms.description: The passageway continues to the south and east at this point.  The stones of this passageway are of the purest black and as smooth as glass.  Surely this passageway was created through magical means.  There are doors to the north and west.

rooms.name: Hall of Despite
rooms.description: More than anything else, this room appears to be a shrine to the long dead King Ureal.  Dozens of portraits hang from the wall, showing the king at various ages and in various activities: as a boy, accepting the throne upon the death of his father; as a young man, mastering the sword; and at middle-age, defeating a hated foe.  The hall continues through an archway to the west, and there is a door to the east.

rooms.name: Hall of Despite
rooms.description: This hall, like the section to the east, also bears a great many portraits. Many of the paintings portray the King later in life.  In one picture you find particularly interesting, five women, standing with hands linked, surround the king.  The expression on the women's face is one of rapture, and on the king's, one of triumph.  There is an archway to the east.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The passageway continues to the west.  The stones of this passageway are of the purest black and as smooth as glass.  Surely this passageway was created through magical means.  There is a door to the east.

rooms.name: Library
rooms.description: The library is spacious.  A comfortable reading chair lies in the middle of the room, and bookshelves line the wall.  On the bookshelves are a vast array of leather-bound books.  Someone has taken very good care of this room.  There are doors to the west and south.

rooms.name: Wizard's Lab
rooms.description: This room is filled with a variety of apparatus.  You recognize rulers, scales, glass tubes and beakers.  Nothing in the room hints at anything sinister; every item in this room could conceivably be found in the workshop of an alchemist or engineer.  There is a door to the north, and archways to the west and east.

South.description: Lost in the shadows, you see a door.

rooms.name: Storage Room
rooms.description: Stone shelves line this room, on which sit numerous glass containers. There containers hold the ingredients for the wizard's spells.  There is an archway to the west.

rooms.name: Chamber of Summoning
rooms.description: The first thing you notice as you enter this room are the human limbs strewn across the floor.  These limbs are very pale, as though drained of all blood. You wonder what sort of creature is powerful enough to rend a man's body in this way.  The floor is covered with strange magical markings, and incense makes the room smell sickingly sweet.

rooms.name: Anatomy Room
rooms.description: As you enter this room your attention is immediately drawn to the cold stone slab which occupies the center of the room, upon which lies the body of some humanoid creature.  Wrinkling your nose at the stench, you approach the creature and observe that it has been dissected recently, apparently while fully conscious-- the intense expression of agony frozen on its face can mean nothing else.  There is a door to the south and an archway to the east.

rooms.name: Stockade
rooms.description: You have entered a dirty, smelly room.  Old rusty chains, connected to stout iron rings inset in the wall, litter the floor.  The room is empty, but you get the feeling it was recently occupied.  There is a door to the north.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The stones of this passageway are of the purest black and as smooth as glass.  Surely this passageway was created through magical means.  The passageway continues to the east, and there is a door to the south.

North.description: You see the faint outline of a panel.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The stones of this passageway are of the purest black and as smooth as glass.  Surely this passageway was created through magical means.  The passageway continues to the west and east.

rooms.name: Bend in the Passageway
rooms.description: The stones of this passageway are of the purest black and as smooth as glass.  Surely this passageway was created through magical means.  The passageway continues to the west and north.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The stones of this passageway are of the purest black and as smooth as glass.  Surely this passageway was created through magical means.  The passageway continues to the south and there is a door to the north.

rooms.name: The Study
rooms.description: This room bears the signs of not having been used in a very long time; the desk and furniture are thickly layered with dust.  There is a map on the wall showing the borders of some kingdom long since forgotten.  There are doors to the north, south, and east.

rooms.name: The Bedroom
rooms.description: Like the study to the west, this room has not been used in many years.  The furniture in the room is poorly preserved, the wood heavily infested with worms.  There is a door to the west.

rooms.name: Art Studio
rooms.description: This studio is the workshop of a talented artist.  The walls of the studio are adorned with the artist's favorite paintings; many of these paintings feature outdoor landscapes.  The only exit is to the south.

North.description: Lost in the shadows, you see a door.

rooms.name: Chamber of Eternity
rooms.description: Running the length of the room is a mural which depicts the reign of King Ureal.  The artisan makes no attempt to disguise the cruelty of Ureal; rather, he seems to revel in it.  The mural documents the king's quest for immortality. Apparently, in an attempt to become immortal, the King embraced the dark arts of wizardry.  The mural also depicts a knight in golden armor, wielding an indigo blade, challenging the king.  The knight is defeated, and the king begins the ravage of his own kingdom.  The mural was intended to continue, but ends abruptly, leaving one section only partially completed.

South.description: Lost in the shadows, you see a door..

rooms.name: Bone Littered Passageway
rooms.description: You have entered a passageway which runs east and west.  The bones of many creatures are scattered about this portion of the passageway.  It looks like some creature devours its prey here.

rooms.name: Gouged Pillar Passageway
rooms.description: A huge stone pillar stands in the midst of this passageway.  At one time, the pillar was elaborately decorated with leaves and scrolls; however it now bears tremendous furrows along its length.  You wonder what sort of tool would make such marks.  The passageway continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The passageway continues to the north and south.  For a moment, you believe you hear a faint clicking sound, but the sound does not repeat itself. Perhaps it was only your imagination...

rooms.name: Gouged Pillar Passageway
rooms.description: A huge stone pillar stands in the midst of this passageway.  At one time, the pillar was elaborately decorated with leaves and scrolls; however it now bears tremendous furrows along its length.  You wonder what sort of tool would make such marks.  The passageway continues to the west and south.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The passageway continues to the west and east.  There is a foul odor coming from the west.  For a moment, you believe you hear faint clicking sound, but the sound does not repeat itself.  Perhaps it was only your imagination...

rooms.name: Rank Passageway
rooms.description: You have entered a portion of the passageway which smells worse than a dozen sewers.  This appears to be the privy of some giant creature.  The stench makes you want to retch.  You should hurry out of this area.  The passageway continues to the west and east.

South.description: Lost in the shadows, you see a door.

rooms.name: Gouged Pillar Passageway
rooms.description: A huge stone pillar stands in the midst of this passageway.  At one time, the pillar was elaborately decorated with leaves and scrolls; however it now bears tremendous furrows along its length.  You wonder what sort of tool would make such marks.  The passageway continues to the east and south.  You detect a foul odor from the east.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The passageway continues to the north and south.  For a moment, you believe you hear a faint clicking sound, but the sound does not repeat itself. Perhaps it was only your imagination...

rooms.name: Gouged Pillar Passageway
rooms.description: A huge stone pillar stands in the midst of this passageway.  At one time, the pillar was elaborately decorated with leaves and scrolls; however it now bears tremendous furrows along its length.  You wonder what sort of tool would make such marks.  The passageway continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: Passageway
rooms.description: The passageway continues to the west and east.  For a moment, you believe you hear a faint clicking sound, but the sound does not repeat itself. Perhaps it was only your imagination...

rooms.name: Witch's Den
rooms.description: As you open the door and step into this room, you are immediately assaulted by stale, rank air.  It seems this room is occupied by several creatures which do not often leave the confines.  The room itself is fairly clean, though certainly disorganized.  There is an alcove on one side of the room; in the alcove, there is a picture of a tall man with cold eyes.  The alcove looks like a place of worship.  There are doors to the east and north.

East.description: You see a door, engraved with demons and gods.

rooms.name: Throne of the Lich
rooms.description: Your footsteps are loud and intrusive in this quiet hall.  Aside from the shuffling of your feet, the room is dead silent, and you get the feeling it has been silent for a very long time.  Silent, but not deserted.  Across from you rises a dais, upon which is a throne sculpted from a semi-translucent greenish rock.  Two pillars, one black and one white, flank the dais.  The pillars' purpose seems decorative, rather than supportive.  The door behind you has disappeared; you may not return to the room from which you arrived.  There is a small fissure in the floor leading down.

Down.description: You see a dark fissure leading down into the depths.

rooms.name: Secret Room
rooms.description: This room is small, perhaps four meters wide and six meters tall.  The air smells ancient.

rooms.name: Treasure Room
rooms.description: You have discovered the treasure room of a long dead king.  You wonder what use a dead man would have for treasure; perhaps he believed he would keep it in the afterlife.  You are not the first adventurer to ever find this room, however.  Resting against a wooden chest is the skeleton of a man.  His clothes hang from his bones in tatters, his armor rusted and useless.

extras.text: The skeleton's armor is rusting and his clothes are in tatters. The man apparently died in battle, for with one hand he grips the hilt of a rusty broadsword. His other hand seems to be gripping some object...

rooms.name: Holding Room for Barrows NO MORTALS ALLOWED
rooms.description: If you are here, get out!
